home.description: I am a postdoc working at the The Center for Astrochemical Studies of the Max Planck Institute for Extraterrestrial Physics.  I'm primarily interested in observations of the very youngest protostars.  Ultimately I seek to unite dust, kinematic, chemical, and polarization observations of embedded protostars to understand the role that young disks and their surrounding envelopes play in the first steps of planet formation.
home.highlight: I specialize in high-resolution (sub-arcsecond) interferometric observations of nearby embedded protostars.
